member.name: T:PagedList.PagedList`1
member.summary: Represents a subset of a collection of objects that can be individually accessed by index and containing metadata about the superset collection of objects this subset was created from.

member.name: M:PagedList.PagedList`1.#ctor(System.Linq.IQueryable{`0},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that divides the supplied superset into subsets the size of the supplied pageSize. The instance then only containes the objects contained in the subset specified by index.
member.param: The collection of objects to be divided into subsets. If the collection implements , it will be treated as such.
The one-based index of the subset of objects to be contained by this instance.
The maximum size of any individual subset.
member.exception: The specified index cannot be less than zero.
The specified page size cannot be less than one.

member.name: M:PagedList.PagedList`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Int32,System.Int32)

The one-based index of the subset of objects to be contained by this instance.
The maximum size of any individual subset.
member.exception: The specified index cannot be less than zero.
The specified page size cannot be less than one.

member.name: M:PagedList.PagedListExtensions.Split``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits a collection of objects into n pages with an (for example, if I have a list of 45 shoes and say 'shoes.Split(5)' I will now have 4 pages of 10 shoes and 1 page of 5 shoes.
member.typeparam: The type of object the collection should contain.
member.param: The collection of objects to be divided into subsets.
The number of pages this collection should be split into.
member.returns: A subset of this collection of objects, split into n pages.

member.name: M:PagedList.PagedListExtensions.Partition``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits a collection of objects into an unknown number of pages with n items per page (for example, if I have a list of 45 shoes and say 'shoes.Partition(10)' I will now have 4 pages of 10 shoes and 1 page of 5 shoes.
member.typeparam: The type of object the collection should contain.
member.param: The collection of objects to be divided into subsets.
The maximum number of items each page may contain.
member.returns: A subset of this collection of objects, split into pages of maximum size n.

member.name: T:PagedList.StaticPagedList`1
member.summary: Represents a subset of a collection of objects that can be individually accessed by index and containing metadata about the superset collection of objects this subset was created from.

member.name: M:PagedList.StaticPagedList`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},PagedList.IPagedList)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that contains the already divided subset and information about the size of the superset and the subset's position within it.
member.param: The single subset this collection should represent.

Supply the ".MetaData" property of an existing IPagedList instance to recreate it here (such as when creating a new instance of a PagedList after having used Automapper to convert its contents to a DTO.)
member.exception: The specified index cannot be less than zero.
The specified page size cannot be less than one.

member.name: M:PagedList.StaticPagedList`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that contains the already divided subset and information about the size of the superset and the subset's position within it.
member.param: The single subset this collection should represent.
The one-based index of the subset of objects contained by this instance.
The maximum size of any individual subset.
The size of the superset.
member.exception: The specified index cannot be less than zero.
The specified page size cannot be less than one.
